SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

No. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

A word of explanation to the person answering this questionnaire

It is difficult to prepare a general questionnaire on pioneer life because no individual who is asked to answer it has exactly the same experiences as another. Some of the questions here will not apply to your experiences; others may prove impossible for you to answer, so don't worry about leaving blank spaces. Use extra sheets of paper if there is not sufficient space to answer the questions. Don't hesitate to give details, or describe particular events, if they help to answer the questions.

This questionnaire is intended for persons who lived in Western Canada before 1914, and may be answered by anyone who has personal experience of the pioneer years whether born in this province or not.

If more than one member of the family can answer the questions, they should write them on separate sheets or apply for a separate questionnaire.

Other Questionnaires

Saskatchewan Archives Questionnaire No. 1, entitled "Pioneer Diet: What Did Western Canadian Pioneers Eat?" is still being circulated. If you have not already answered this, and would be willing to do so, please put a check mark here ( ) and one will be sent to you.

Saskatchewan Archives questionnaires on other subjects will be prepared at a later date. Some of these are listed below. Please mark the ones you would be willing to answer.

( ) All questionnaires
( ) Pioneer health conditions
( ) Pioneer social life, sports and recreation
( ) Pioneer housing
( ) Pioneer education and churchwork
( ) Pioneer farming experience

Preservation of Questionnaires

All questionnaires will be preserved in the Saskatchewan Archives Board's Office at the University of Saskatchewan as part of the permanent record of our Province. Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.
SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRE

No. 2

PIONEER EXPERIENCES: A GENERAL QUESTIONNAIRE

NOTE: Please print all proper names and place names in capital letters. If you are not sure the name is correct as you have given it, please say so. If you'd rather have someone else do the writing at your dictation, this is quite acceptable.

1. Your full name ...........................................
2. Your address ..............................................
3. Date ..........................................................
4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country) .....................................................
5. What was your father's name and occupation? .............................................................
6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year) ...........................................
7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible. .............................................................
8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child", "I was in my teens", etc). .............................................................
9. What were your reasons for coming West? .............................................................
10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?). ............................................................
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada? They thought we were crazy.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)? Group of people from some village, and family.

13. What means of transportation did you use? Train - shipped in covered wagon.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement etc.). Met some Indians in the wagon, journey from Red Deer to the homestead. Got from 75 miles down as we later cold, Howell.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan? Red Deer.

16. Where did you settle or take up land? Leo Field District.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan. Nowhere.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How after you came as a farm laborer before; and any labor we could get.
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?
   *felt very often as we were away from work.*

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date
    and place of marriage.
    *I got Married in 1911 on October 12th at Regina Koba in Howell Parish Church.*

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommending it as a place
    to settle?
    *Yes. I helped out here 2 families of 4 in 1920, and again 2 more single men in 1928.*

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West
    tell when they came and where they settled.
    *My Father and Mother came in 1903, we all settled in same place.*

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your
    memory which you would like to record?
    *It was very hard, yet ever very happy, because our independence, a free life on our own land.*

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business, attending church,
    visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?
    *Yes every weekend, and mostly Sundays traveling with horse wagon, church and visiting Friends, milo.*
25. When was the first car used in the community? around 1916-17

26. If you owned a car before 1914, when did you buy it? What make? nil

27. Where was your trading center? How far from your home? Howell (6 miles)

28. Did you continue to trade there? (Indicate any changes due to new towns appearing, better means of travel, etc.)

29. How often did you shop in the early days? every two weeks

30. When (if ever) did people in your district first start going to town regularly on Saturdays? 1914-15

31. When (if ever) did you first begin to buy through the mail order catalogues? What kind of articles did you buy in this way? Indicate also what fraction of your total purchases were by mail order and any changes in the proportion of purchases made by mail order since then.

Georgina in 1909, but more amounts in later years

32. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it? 1922, Bell Telephone Co., Rural Telephone & a Rural Home

33. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision?

As we were making our money, don't go back to old country. We make decision after first world war 1918 of staying forever.
34. Did any people move away from your district prior to 1914? What reasons did they have for moving?

35. Did many people move away during the 1930's? Did many return?

36. If you or some member of your family have held public office, or have been active in any organizations, mention it here, giving dates wherever possible.

37. If you or any of your family or friends were "first" to have or do something in the district mention it here giving dates wherever possible. (Such as owning the first automobile, combine, organizing the first lodge, etc.)

38. How did the places in your community get their names? (School districts, post offices, villages, railway stations, creeks, hills, etc.) Try to give: (1) name and occupation of person suggesting place-name (2) origin and meaning of the name (3) date of its adoption (4) any changes in names since the first name was given date and reason for change. Give facts of new name as above in (1), (2), (3).

Jonathan Lake S.D. from the salt lake side by Post office and the village near Butten's name Waverly latter years were changed to Reed Home, for the name of the property of James Alden, Reed Homestead. The School names for Jonathan Lake were changed St. Joseph's name of the Church, near by.
37. Questions regarding historical source materials:

Do you have in your possession or do you know the whereabouts of diaries, old letters, old posters and programs, minute books of community organizations, old pamphlets, old photographs, written recollections and reminiscences? (Describe).

Would you or the person who owns them either

(1) be willing to lend them to the Provincial Archivist for copying? .......

(2) be willing to present them to the Archives Division of the Legislative Library, Regina, or the Archives Office at the University in Saskatoon? ....... (indicate your preference, if any) ................

40. If you have children or grandchildren, please give their names, where they live and occupations.

My wife and I have 10 children & boys and 5 Girls. 6 Teachers & Girls, and one boy. 2 Boys are farming in a District of Red River, both own the same place. 1 Boy teaching in Prince George B.C. as an Principal, one Girl teaching High School in Waskatoa, one Boy Rail Engineer in Leduc Camp B.C., one Boy in The Navy Station in Halifax N.S. (One girl farmer)

41. What do you think are the most important changes in your community since you first came West? — We also have 19 Grand children, and now more coming & doing.

Telephone and Electrification.

also, all the Roads.

Please give the names and addresses of other pioneers who could answer this questionnaire.

If someone else has filled in this questionnaire for you, please have this person give name and address here:

I did it myself

Saw me for my Poor making
